Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Suppository \Sup*pos"i*to*ry\, n.; pl. {Suppositories}. [LL. suppositorium, fr. L. suppositorius that is placed underneath: cf. F. suppositoire. See {Supposition}.] (Med.) A pill or bolus for introduction into the rectum; esp., a cylinder or cone of medicated cacao butter. [1913 Webster]
